meanings.def: not one nor the other of two things or people
examples: Neither of them has/have a car.
They produced two reports, neither of which contained any useful suggestions.
‘Which do you like?’ ‘Neither. I think they're both ugly.’
Neither candidate was selected for the job.
Neither of my parents speaks/​speak a foreign language.

meanings.def: used to show that a negative statement is also true of somebody/something else
examples: He didn't remember and neither did I.
I hadn't been to New York before and neither had Jane.
‘I can't understand a word of it.’ ‘Neither can I.’

meanings.def: used to show that a negative statement is true of two things
examples: I neither knew nor cared what had happened to him.
Their house is neither big nor small.
Neither the TV nor the DVD player actually work/works.
